How to Clean and Disinfect Your Phone, Screen and Phone Case
Washing hands to prevent the spread of germs is easy, but what about smartphones? Like door knobs, phones are high touch surfaces that should be regularly cleaned and sanitized, and when necessary disinfected.
More from Clorox experts
Discover more ways to clean.
Use as directed.
It’s important to remember that mobile phones are high touch surfaces just like toilet handles, which makes a mobile phone a potential germ hotspot. Keeping your phone clean and sanitized with
Clorox® Disinfecting Wipes
and periodically disinfecting it when needed is easy and helps prevent the spread of illness during cold and flu season and all year long.
In fact, studies show just how contaminated mobile phones are: they have been linked to the spread of illness in health care environments. Depending on a person’s personal hygiene habits, like how often they wash their hands, germs on a phone may be a problem in the home environment, too. Fortunately, it’s easy and convenient to use disinfecting wipes on most phone screens and cases. Always follow manufacturer's instructions for cleaning and disinfecting of electronics.

Cleaning and sanitizing is fast
Make it part of your daily routine
Sanitizing means reducing germs to a level acceptable by public health standards. It only takes 10 seconds for Clorox® Disinfecting Wipes to sanitize a smartphone. If there’s obvious dirt, wipe it away first, then give the phone a quick wipe down and make sure it stays visibly wet for 10 seconds. Disinfecting a phone requires a longer contact time described below. Disinfecting is a higher level of germ kill than sanitizing, where bacteria and viruses are effectively eliminated.

Steps for disinfecting your phone screen and case*
Power down your device
If your cell phone’s manufacturer’s guide says bleach-free disinfecting wipes are an appropriate way to clean your device, begin by turning off and unplugging your phone.
Tip
Apple recommends products like Clorox® Disinfecting Wipes
to effectively and safely clean every Apple product.
Wipe your phone's screen
Wipe the screen, tops, sides and back of your phone. Avoid getting any liquid into the buttons or other openings.
Tip
To disinfect, use enough wipes for treated surfaces to remain visibly wet for 4 minutes.
Clean your case
Clean your phone case thoroughly. Don’t use Clorox® Disinfecting Wipes on fabric or leather cases.
Dry the phone
Let the surfaces air dry.
*
For electronics, please refer to the manufacturer's cleaning instructions.

An important safety message
Bleach and other disinfectants are not suitable for consumption or injection under any circumstances. People should always read the label for proper usage instructions. Disinfecting surfaces with bleach and the disinfecting products is one of the ways to help stop the spread of COVID-19, according to the Centers for Disease Control. Our products are safe when used as directed. It’s critical that everyone understands the facts in order to keep themselves safe and healthy.
